Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database is configured correctly. It does this by executing a SQL query and checking if it returns any results. If it doesn’t, then we know something’s wrong.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.root()¶
async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are used by the app, such as databases or caches.

Returns:

A future, so we need to await it

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API database DB¶

src.database.db.get_db()¶

The get_db function is a context manager that returns the database session. It also handles any exceptions that may occur during the session, and closes the connection when it’s done.

Returns:

A database session that can be used to query the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current logged in user

Returns:

The contact created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_birthday(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_birthday function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

The function takes two arguments: skip and limit, which are used to paginate the results. It also takes a db Session object as an argument.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n number of contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned by the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthday in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact from the database by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact that we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to be used for querying

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of records in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • first_name – str: Filter the contacts by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Filter the contacts by email

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A connection to the database. user (User): The user who is removing this contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated information for the specified user’s contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that is being updated

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the json data from the request body to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

The updated contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.verify_email_phone(email: str, phone: str, db: Session)¶
The verify_email_phone function is used to verify that the email and phone number provided by the user are not already in use.

If either of them are, then an error message will be returned to the user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email address to the function

  • phone – str: Pass in the phone number to be verified

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A tuple of email and phone data

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user who’s account is being confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Specify the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user that we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first user that matches the email address, or none if no such user exists

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id, which is used to find the user in the database

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh_token field in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database,we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not.

If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular record to

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a confirmation of your email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies them against the database, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dict with the access token and refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token, refresh token and a bearer type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes in a UserModel object, which is validated by pydantic. If the email already exists, it will return an HTTP 409 error code (conflict). Otherwise, it will create a new user and send them an email to verify their account.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Validate the data passed in the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with two keys: user and detail

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes an email, phone and name as input parameters. The function returns the newly created contact object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Validate the data that is sent in the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthday(skip: int = 0, limit: int = Query(10), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_birthday function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the current month.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n records in a query

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of results returned

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

Returns:

A list of contacts with the same birthday as the current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. If no such contact exists, it raises an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the path

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_name(skip: int = 0, limit: int = Query(10), first_name: str | None = Query(None), last_name: str | None = Query(None), email: str | None = Query(None), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_name function is used to retrieve a contact by name.
The function takes in the following parameters:

skip (int): The number of contacts to skip before returning results. Default value is 0. limit (int): The maximum number of contacts to return per request. Default value is 10, with a minimum of 1 and maximum of 50 allowed values for this parameter. first_name (str): A string containing the first name associated with the contact being searched for in the database, if any exists; default value None means that no search will be performed on this field when searching for a contact record in the

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of records

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • ge – Set the minimum value for a parameter

  • le – Limit the number of results returned by the query

  • first_name – Optional[str]: Specify that the first_name parameter is optional

  • last_name – Optional[str]: Filter the results by last name

  • email – Optional[str]: Filter the contacts by email

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact by name

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session, optional): SQLAlchemy Session. Defaults to Depends(get_db). current_user (User, optional): User object for authentication and authorization purposes. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
The function takes three arguments:

  • body: A ContactModel object containing the new values for the contact.

  • contact_id: An integer representing the ID of an existing contact to be updated.

  • db (optional): A Session object used to connect to and query a database, if not provided, one will be created automatically using get_db().

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact information to be updated

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact we want to delete

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the user_id from the jwt token

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

It requires authentication, and it uses the auth_service to get the current user.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file that has been uploaded to the server. It also takes in a User object and Session object as dependencies.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

The function takes in two arguments: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary that contains all of the information about the user, such as their username, email address, etc. Expires_delta is an optional argument that specifies how long you want your access token to be valid for (in minutes). If no value is specified then it defaults to 120 minutes (2 hours). The function first creates a copy of the data dictionary called to_encode and adds three additional key-value pairs: iat which stands for issued at time and represents when

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current object

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A string that is the encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp). The iat and exp values are added to the data dict before encoding.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that we want to encode

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email and a timestamp

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s information

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiry time of the token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded using the secret_key and algorithm

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

UserResource class. It takes an OAuth2 token as input and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object, which is used to identify the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (i.e., localhost). This will be used as part of a URL that they can click on within their browser.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname to the template

Returns:

A coroutine which is a special type of object that can be used with await or yield from

Doc-author:

Trelent
